intro: Spirastigma, commonly known as the spiral flower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its unique spiral arrangement of petals, which gives it a distinctive and ornamental appearance. The plant typically grows as an annual herb with slender stems and small, clustered flowers. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets arranged symmetrically. Spirastigma is native to various regions in Africa and is often cultivated for its aesthetic value in gardens.
